sense.name: price
sense.commentary: The amount of money, labor, or time required to attain goods and services.
sense.examples: The cost of living is way too high! I got this set of knives for the low, low cost of $19.95. Microsoft lowered the marginal unit cost for its products. The cost of this sweater is too high for me.

sense.name: value
sense.commentary: The amount that something is worth, or the value that it has accumulated. This is a rare usage.
sense.examples: I've never calculated the cost of my stamp collection, but I'm sure it would sell for a lot of money.

sense.name: metaphoric price
sense.commentary: The value of something, as measured by what must be sacrificed, done, or undergone to obtain it. Does not refer to money, labor, or time.
sense.examples: I survived the experience at the cost of my dignity. If the United States invaded Canada, the cost in human lives would be enormous. John paid a terrible emotional cost for his love of Mary.
